alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Red Willow County through 530 PM CDT... At 459 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of McCook, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Red Willow County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
